title: Multiprocessing Error on Windows
body_html:
@peterjc123, @yf225
When we call

Data.DataLoader(dataset=torch_dataset, batch_size=BATCH_SIZE, shuffle=True, num_workers=2,)

it will show errors:
Traceback (most recent call last):
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "", line 1, in
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
self = load(from_parent)
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
self = load(from_parent)
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
return Unpickler(file).load()
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
return Unpickler(file).load()
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
dispatchkey
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1221, in load_build
setstate = getattr(inst, "setstate", None)
dispatchkey
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in getattr
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1221, in load_build
return getattr(self.conn, name)
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in getattr
return getattr(self.conn, name)
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in getattr
return getattr(self.conn, name)
File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in getattr
...
return getattr(self.conn, name)
RuntimeError: maximum recursion depth exceeded

if we set num_workers=2, the code can run.

body:
@peterjc123, @yf225
When we call 
```python
Data.DataLoader(dataset=torch_dataset, batch_size=BATCH_SIZE, shuffle=True, num_workers=2,)
```
it will show errors:
Traceback (most recent call last):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\multiprocessing\forking.py", line 381, in main
    self = load(from_parent)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
    self = load(from_parent)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1384, in load
    return Unpickler(file).load()
      File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
return Unpickler(file).load()
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 864, in load
    dispatch[key](self)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1221, in load_build
        setstate = getattr(inst, "__setstate__", None)
dispatch[key](self)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in __getattr__
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\pickle.py", line 1221, in load_build
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in __getattr__
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
  File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in __getattr__
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
      File "C:\C:\Python36_X64\lib\site-packages\torch\multiprocessing\queue.py", line 27, in __getattr__
...
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
RuntimeError: maximum recursion depth exceeded

if we set num_workers=2, the code can run.
